intro: Neltuma occidentalis, commonly known as the western neltuma, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and other related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Neltuma occidentalis is considered a vulnerable species.
